list.abs: I begrudge spending so much money on buying clothes ., 我舍不得在买衣服上花这么多钱.
We don ' t begrudge your going to Italy ., 我们并不羡慕你到意大利去.
No one begrudges him his good fortune ., 无人嫉妒他的好运.
No one begrudged helping him ., 没有人不愿意帮助他.

entry.def: If you do not begrudge someone something, you do not feel angry, upset, or jealous that they have got it.

example.ex: I certainly don't begrudge him the Nobel Prize.
example.tran: 我当然不会嫉妒他得了诺贝尔奖。

entry.def: If you do not begrudge something such as time or money, you do not mind giving it up.

example.ex: I do not begrudge the money I have lost.

auth_sentence.content: But Lewis goes far further than this, begrudging them their very beliefs.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Lewis goes far further than this, begrudging them their very beliefs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Lewis goes far further than this, begrudging them their very beliefs.

auth_sentence.content: This is, as Gilbert notes, perhaps the most begrudging endorsement of matrimony in human history.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is, as Gilbert notes, perhaps the most begrudging endorsement of matrimony in human history.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is, as Gilbert notes, perhaps the most begrudging endorsement of matrimony in human history.

auth_sentence.content: She was like an animal, he thought, as silent and begrudging as an owl.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was like an animal, he thought, as silent and begrudging as an owl.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was like an animal, he thought, as silent and begrudging as an owl.
